checkers

Class Move

  • java.lang.Object
    • checkers.Move
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Move
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class to save one particular Move. A move consists of many different variable which are all saved in this class. Furthermore, it includes all static methods for selecting possible moves.

    It is neccessary to know that in our definition of a move a move also contains a mulitjump which consists of various directions which are saved in the global array directions. So even if a mulitjump consist of many subcomponents which could be also seen as a move, it is one move.

    Author:
    Till, Marco
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Move

        public Move(Move.MoveDirection[] directions,
            Move.MoveType type,
            int x,
            int y)
        This is the constructor with the most input parameters which are all important in order to have all information. It is suitable for multijumps, because you transfer an array of direction.

        Parameters:
        directions - An array of variables from the enumeration MoveDirection.
        type - The type of the move(from enum MoveType)
        x - An integer variable which is representing a point on the vertical axis of the playfield.
        y - An integer variable which is representing a point on the horizontal axis of the playfield.

      • Move

        public Move(Move.MoveDirection direction,
            Move.MoveType type,
            int x,
            int y)

      • Move

        private Move(Move.MoveType type)
        This constructor is only used for invalid moves

        Parameters:
        type - should only be MoveType.INVALID

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        public Move copy()
        The method basically duplicates the object move. As a result the move returned by this method will describe the exact same movement on the playfield.

        Returns:
        A new move object.

      • addStep

        public void addStep(Move.MoveDirection dir)
        A step is being added to an already existing move. It inserts a new variable from the enumeration MoveDirection into the global moveDirection array. This is needed when a move is going to be a multijump in which more than one direction is possible.

        Parameters:
        dir - A variables from the enumeration MoveDirection .

      • setMoveType

        public void setMoveType(Move.MoveType pType)
        This methods sets the type of the move.

        Parameters:
        pType - A variable form the enumeration MoveType.

      • getMoveType

        public Move.MoveType getMoveType()
        This method returns the type of this move object.

        Returns:
        A variable form the enumeration MoveType.

      • getMoveDirection

        public Move.MoveDirection getMoveDirection(int step)
        Returns a certain direction from the directions array which saves all direction of a move successively.

        Parameters:
        step - An Integer variable which represents one of the subcomponent of a move.
        Returns:
        A variable from the enumeration MoveDirection.

      • getMoveDirection

        public Move.MoveDirection getMoveDirection()
        Returns the first direction of the direcions array. It is suitable for steps and jumps that do not involve more than one direction

        Returns:
        A variable from the enumeration MoveDirection.

      • getSteps

        public int getSteps()
        Returns the number of the move components one jump has.(jumps and steps have always only one)

        Returns:
        A integer variable which saves the amount of move components one move has.

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Returns the x axis of the playfield from which a move is going to be performed. It is where the figure which is going to be moved was in the initial situation.

        Returns:
        An integer variable which is representing a point on the horizontal axis of the playfield.

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Returns the y axis of the playfield from which a move is going to be performed. It is where the figure which is going to be moved was in the initial situation.
        Returns:
        An integer variable which is representing a point on the vertical axis of the playfield.

      • isInvalid

        public boolean isInvalid()
        This method tests if the type of the global variable type (@see MoveType) has been set to INVALID. IF this is the case the method returns true.

        Returns:
        A boolean which if true declares the move as invalid(unexecutable).

      • createMoveFromCoords

        public static Move createMoveFromCoords(int[][] coords)
        turns an array of coordinates into a move object !ATTENTION!:the method does not apply complete move validation! So the move could not be valid although it is not set invalid! Test with Gamelogic.testMove()!

        Parameters:
        coords - a two dimensional integer array which respresents in chronological order on which fields the figure was during the move.
        Returns:
        move A Move object that represents the move described by the coordinates.

      • getPossibleJumps

        public static List<Move> getPossibleJumps(Figure figure,
                                          Playfield field)
        Parameters:
        figure - the figure that should jump
        field - the Playfield that is used to search for jumps
        Returns:
        returns every possible jump for the given Figure on the given Playfield

      • getMultiJumps

        public static List<Move> getMultiJumps(int x,
                                       int y,
                                       Playfield field)
        This method returns a list containing all possible multijumps from the figure standing on the given coordinates on the given playfield.

        Parameters:
        x - An integer variable which is representing a point on the horizontal axis of the playfield.
        y - An integer variable which is representing a point on the vertical axis of the playfield.
        field - Field is an Object which represents the playfield.
        Returns:
        List This new List contains all the possible multijumps on a specific playfield situation for one figure.

      • jumpIsPossible

        public static boolean jumpIsPossible(Figure.FigureColor color,
                                     Playfield field)
        Parameters:
        color - of the figures that should be tested.
        field - playfield to test on.
        Returns:
        Returns true if a jump with a figure of the given color on the given playfield is possible.

      • getPossibleSteps

        public static List<Move> getPossibleSteps(Figure f,
                                          Playfield p)
        Parameters:
        f - The figure that should step.
        p - The Playfield that is used to search for steps.
        Returns:
        Returns every possible step for the given Figure on the given Playfield.

      • getPossibleMoves

        public static List<Move> getPossibleMoves(Figure figure,
                                          Playfield playfield)
        Parameters:
        figure - The figure that should move.
        playfield - The Playfield that is used to search for moves.
        Returns:
        Returns every possible move for the given Figure on the given Playfield.

      • getPossibleMoves

        public static List<Move> getPossibleMoves(Figure.FigureColor color,
                                          Playfield playfield)
        Parameters:
        color - The figureColor of the figures to find moves for.
        playfield - The Playfield that is used to search for moves.
        Returns:
        Returns a List with every possible move for all figures on the field that have the FigureColor color on the given Playfield.
